items.name: M.
items.headline: A2 → B1 in four months
items.text: Started at A2; four months later I passed the exam and can argue my point at B1. The talk-first lessons and weekly writing briefs finally made French stick.

items.name: A.
items.headline: From anxious to fluent conversations
items.text: I always froze. With role-plays and "say-it-better" loops, the fear disappeared. I now handle calls at work without switching to English.

items.name: J.

items.text: Clear templates, pacing drills, and constant feedback. Hit my CLB targets and moved forward with my application.

steps.title: Start: Introduction and Plan
steps.description:
We connect, I learn your goal and timeline.
I understand what's working and what needs attention.
I create a clear week-by-week plan and give you first simple tasks.

steps.title: Lessons: You Speak More
steps.description:
In class, you speak about 70% of the time.
We take topics from your life and practice answering concisely and directly, like in the real exam.
I gently correct and provide ready phrases to sound confident.

steps.title: Practice Between Lessons and Visible Progress
steps.description:
Small 5–10 minute tasks on non-lesson days.
You send voice notes—I respond and correct.
Every 2 weeks we review before/after: you hear how your speech becomes more fluent.

items.question: How many lessons per week?
items.answer: Typically 3×60-min lessons per week, but the schedule can be adjusted based on your availability and goals. We'll finalize the best cadence during your trial lesson.

items.question: Do you provide materials?
items.answer: Yes—curated, level-appropriate content plus original materials (incl. textbook co-authored by the tutor) and targeted drills.

items.question: Can you register me for exams?
items.answer: I prepare you and advise on dates/centers; you register and pay the exam center directly.

items.question: Will we only do speaking?
items.answer: Speaking is the core (70%), but every plan includes listening, reading, writing, and pronunciation—weighted to your goal (DELF/DALF or workplace needs).

items.question: Do you teach groups?
items.answer: Yes, group sessions are available. We'll discuss the best format for your goals during the trial lesson.

items.question: What's your background?
items.answer: DALF C2; official DELF-DALF & TEF examiner; former director at Alliance Française Bishkek; university + international school experience.
